title: docs: don't output logs in setup step
Prepare rc1 release
body:
This pull request prepares the following packages for release:

- xtensa-lx: 0.13.0
- esp-metadata-generated: 0.2.0
- esp-radio-rtos-driver: 0.1.0
- xtensa-lx-rt-proc-macros: 0.5.0
- esp-sync: 0.1.0
- esp-println: 0.16.0
- esp-riscv-rt: 0.13.0
- esp-metadata: 0.9.0
- esp-rom-sys: 0.1.2
- esp-hal-procmacros: 0.20.0
- esp-lp-hal: 0.3.0
- xtensa-lx-rt: 0.21.0
- esp-config: 0.6.0
- esp-backtrace: 0.18.0
- esp-alloc: 0.9.0
- esp-hal: 1.0.0-rc.1
- esp-bootloader-esp-idf: 0.3.0
- esp-phy: 0.1.0
- esp-storage: 0.8.0
- esp-rtos: 0.1.0
- esp-radio: 0.16.0

title: fixup bump version for new examples structure
body: The examples are now separate packages, so this must be handled in the dependency checks.

title: semver download: don't exit early when not in gh runner
body: This check seemed a bit strong, it works just fine as long as `gh` is installed. This also adds logic to download the baselines if needed during the release planning process.

title: Make pub use of `ram` macro stable
body: this got lost during rebase in https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/pull/4309

title: Mark funciton with unstable type as param unstable
ADC tweaks
body: This PR makes it a bit more clear that attenuation values are approximate. With this, this PR closes #1406 . This PR also removes Resolution from most chips, side-stepping the confusion around S2's uncertain 12/13 bit resolution. The PR enables missing attenuations on C2, although they aren't useable with calibration. The PR merges some register accesses for slightly better codegen.

title: Merge misc non driver HIL into single binary
body: Progress towards https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4257

title: Merge embassy-timers-executors HIL into single binary
body: Progress towards https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4257

title: ESP32: Fix chunked I2C transfers
body:
Closes #4307

Tested the new example on both ESP32 and S2, S2 does not have the same "END cannot move" limitation.

title: Revert to LLFF as the default
body: TLSF requires an unexpected amount of RAM, which can make updating to the new esp-alloc more surprising than ideal.

title: Run non-nested interrupt handlers last
body:
This PR fixes an RTOS crash which can be triggered by a nested interrupt handler running (and being interrupted) after the scheduler. As an additional bonus, this PR sets the correct runlevel (so that it may actually be observable by interrupt handlers) and does it only once.

This issue can be triggered by running an interrupt executor at a high priority, that is driven by a level 1 interrupt, such as an async GPIO.

title: RTOS/embassy: Add missing feature gate
body: Trying to use the main macro without the embassy feature just gave a very unclear error. The intent was to not even reexport the macro (as the doc decoration suggests), not sure how i forgot the actual feature gate.

title: RTOS: Try to be more helpful with the executor
body:
Let's print more helpful errors when the current task isn't set, or when the executor is started on core 1.

Closes #4312

title: Update esp-backtrace docs
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝

#### Description
The readme table was outdated, and we already relay in `document_features` crate

#### Testing

title: Add `unstable` feature to `esp-hal-procmacros`
body:
closes https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4279  (?)
After looking at that as a whole, I'm wondering if it's not better to just get rid of [`unstable` proc macro on `ram` reexport](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/src/lib.rs#L263). Like, if that `esp-hal-procmacros` package (which users shouldn't even know about), needs `unstable` feature at all, as it's kind of a perma-unstable crate.

Open to opinions here.

title: Deoptimize task deletion, ensure RunQueue::pop is inlined
body:
This PR rearranges `run_scheduler` for better codegen. The difference isn't big, but at least now `RunQueue::pop` gets inlined.

The difference is slight, it can be best seen in the `gpio_unstable::pin_waits_on_core_different_from_interrupt_handler` where the GPIO toggle frequency (which is a funciton of cross-core communication perf) goes from 8kHz to 8.2kHz

title: Ensure asserts can be optimized away
body: This PR removes the debug assert from code where it can be proven that we write back to PS what we read via `rsil`. This includes the vast majority of locks, except for `__esp_phy_exit_critical` and `wifi_int_restore`, which make a lot of sense.

title: Merge `ECC`, `RSA`, and `SHA`  HIL into single binary
body:
AES has a bit more complicated features and envs so I skipped it.
Progress towards https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4257

title: Don't use ADC2 efuse calibration parameters for ADC1, and write appropriate DREF values
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- ~[ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).~
- [X] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [X] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- ~[ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).~
- [X] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [X] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

This PR addresses #4285, where ADC readings would be slightly off, in part due to incorrect calibration parameters being used, and in part due to a missing write to `SAR1_DREF` / `SAR2_DREF`.

#### Description

Two changes have been made to ADC calibration:

1. Fix a bug where ADC2 calibration data always being used. I decided to make this argument into an enum to get type-level checking for invalid values which could have prevented this.
2. Add a register write to `SAR1_DREF` / `SAR2_DREF` in accordance with the [ESP-IDF](https://github.com/espressif/esp-idf/blob/800f141f94c0f880c162de476512e183df671307/components/hal/esp32s3/include/hal/adc_ll.h#L833). They do this before writing the initial code, and omitting it causes the raw values to be slightly off. I can't find any documentation for this field so I have blindly copied the ESP-IDF behavior.

#### Testing

* On my ESP32-S3 board, these two changes bring the ADC readings in line with those from the ESP-IDF, and accurate within about 10 mV for calibrated values.
* I have made changes to other ESP32 variants but have not tested them.

title: Remove default features from esp-rtos, update docs
body: The default features turned out to be problematic - if someone keeps esp-radio enabled but doesn't use it (and doesn't use alloc), the resulting error message is borderline incomprehensable.

title: Merge LCD_CAM HIL into single binary
body: Progress towards https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4257

title: Polish docs 💅
body:
Sorry, I mean clean up / tweak, not to translate them into a language I don't know.

This PR adds chip features to esp-hal/radio/phy docs, fixes a visual issue with config tables, fixes spelling of Wi-Fi, clarifies some things and adds a header to esp-radio's docs.

title: Touch up dependencies
body:
Most of this PR is just de-specifying patch releases for some packages (none of that being too important, it just deletes some differences), and adding support for embedded-io 0.7 to hal/radio.

Closes #4219

title: esp-radio: Rename `Config` to `WifiApStaConfig` and `WifiConfig` to `Config`
body:
To align things with `BLE`,  `WifiConfig` is renamed to `Config`. The old `Config` is renamed to `WifiApStaConfig`.

closes https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4271

title: RTOS tweaks
body:
- This PR fixes the unpredictable time-slice lengths on two cores by tracking each core's deadline.
- This PR improves the scheduler's performance by skipping arming the timer when it's not necessary. The timer takes far longer to arm than expected, possibly due to the u64 division to convert microseconds into timer ticks.
- The PR improves the timer tick handler to only trigger scheduler on the core where it needs to run.
- RunQueue now tracks the running tasks' priority per core, so that it can trigger a task switch when a task can be scheduled onto the core running a lower priority task.

title: RMT: Obtain field witdths from PAC instead of esp-metadata, verify loopcount
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖
I realized that it's possible to obtain maximum field widths from the register specifications in the PAC, so this PR does so and removes values from esp-metadata that were effectively duplicated between PAC and metadata.

Additionally, it adds validation of the maximum loop count for continuous transmission (previously, the `u16` input was silently truncated to the actual 10 bits supported by hardware).

#### Testing
HIL tests, but they don't really test this.

title: Outline some panicking code
body:
The purpose of this PR is to reduce the binary size of applications that use `log`. This is done by wrapping panics caused by unwraps into cold/never inlined functions. This has two effects:

- the compiler is able to use the same function to set up a panic within a crate, reducing duplicate generated code
- the panicking code in unwrap failures is no longer located in instruction ram

This has a tradeoff: panic messages will have the same location, and we will have to rely more on backtraces to show what went wrong.

This PR removes ~8K from the embassy_wifi_i2s QA test's binary, and also a few hundered bytes from the `esp_radio_init` test built for the S3 due to the esp-sync changes.

title: Add missing pub API docstrings
body: closes https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4273

title: Avoid triggering a context switch just to arm embassy timers
body: This PR introduces a trace framework and avoids yielding in order to arm embassy timers. The most visible effect of this PR is that the scheduler no longer runs multiple times in quick succession, but otherwise it should be a very mild perf positive change.

title: I2C: sample SDA earlier
body:
This change aligns the value of `sda_sample` with esp-idf code.

Revival of #3040

title: Prevent the blobs from controlling the PHY clock
body:
Closes #4265

esp-idf would just silently overflow and randomly disable its own PHY clocks, we instead don't let the blobs touch them at all. This might have been introduced by the blob update, but I haven't checked. (skipping changelog because of this - I don't think we had this issue in the last release)

title: Derive defmt::Format for BleConnectorError
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [ ] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description
Derive the missing `defmt::Format` for `BleConnectorError`. Otherwise, [examples/ble/bas_peripheral](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/examples/ble/bas_peripheral) couldn't be compiled when ported to `defmt` (uses `defmt::panic` or `defmt::unwrap` on the results).

#### Testing
Manual test. Compiling local port to `defmt` of [examples/ble/bas_peripheral](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/examples/ble/bas_peripheral) works.

title: RMT: clarify continuous tx API and add HIL tests
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [x] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖
This clarifies what the `Channel::submit_continuously` does, fixes some issues with it, and adds an HIL test (this was entirely untested before). See the commit message:

> It wasn't really well-specified what this method does and hardware support varies wildly.
> The most obvious interpretation to me is that `LoopCount::Finite(n)` should _stop_ tx after `n` repetitions of the data have been submitted. That was never the case, however: Not all devices have hardware support for auto stop, and even on those that have, it wasn't enabled.
> 
> User-facing changes:
> 
> - don't define user-facing API (is_loopcount_interrupt_set, LoopCount::Finite, LoopStop::Auto) when it is not supported such that trying to use unsupported features will fail at compile time
> - add support for finite loopcount for esp32s2 which was missing
> - add support for loop auto stop on supported devices
> - remove dubious special-casing of loopcount 1
> 
> Internal changes:
> - include the new Event::LoopCount in get_tx_status
> - add loopback tests with finite loopcount and manual or auto stop, run on supported devices


#### Testing
HIL tests.

title: Fix clock calculation in I2S
body:
I can't really say that I understand this fixed point calculation, however the fact that b is only divided by 10000 in one case seems obviously wrong to me.

For instance if you call `I2sClockDividers::new(Rate::from_hz(1000000), 2, 8)` you will get:

```
I2sClockDividers {
    mclk_divider: 0,
    bclk_divider: 16,
    denominator: 8,
    numerator: 5,
}
```

This happens because the branch with the exact match is hit. On the other hand if you call `I2sClockDividers::new(Rate::from_hz(1000001), 2, 8)`, then you currently get:

```
I2sClockDividers {
    mclk_divider: 0,
    bclk_divider: 16,
    denominator: 8,
    numerator: 54992,
}
```

title: Avoid panicking when working with large Instant values
body: This PR fixes the panic that occurs for `(Instant::EPOCH + Duration::MAX).duration_since_epoch()`. This issue exists because `fugit` assumes Instant can overflow, which we don't really do with 52/64-bit microsecond ticks

title: twai: fix receive_async erroneously returning overrun
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [x] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [x] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description

The TWAI driver's `receive_async` function currently always returns an error if the `miss_st` bit is set. Normally, the `miss_st` bit indicates that the packet currently readable from the TWAI peripheral's RX FIFO register is incomplete due to a previous buffer overrun. However, under certain circumstances, the TWAI controller will set the `miss_st` bit, although its RX queue is currently empty. This causes the TWAI driver's `receive_async` function to immediatly return indefinitely with an error, indicating that the queue has overrun. To fix this, this commit removes the check for `miss_st` from `receive_async`, because cases of incomplete frames are already handled by the interrupt handler.

Fixes #4235

#### Testing
I tested my changes using the reproduction example in #4235  on an ESP32-C3.

title: twai: fix receive_async returning corrupt frames
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [x] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [x] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖
#### Description

The TWAI driver's async interrupt handler currently parses frames that have the missing bit set, i.e. frames that are either incomplete or completely missing due to a RX FIFO overrun. In the worst-case, this can lead to invalid frames being returned to the caller of receive_async. This commit changes the behaviour in such a way that incomplete or missing frames are released from the fifo, instead.

Fixes #4242

#### Testing
I tested my changes using the example from #4242 on an ESP32-C3.

title: ADC curve calibration overflow
body:
### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description

Fixes integer overflow in ADC curve calibration polynomial evaluation that occurs with certain chip/attenuation
combinations.

**Problem:**
The original implementation evaluated the error polynomial using the direct method:

```
err = coeff[0] + coeff[1]*val + coeff[2]*val^2 + ... + coeff[n]*val^n
```

This caused integer overflow on i64 intermediates when evaluating higher-degree polynomials (degree 4 for 11dB
attenuation) with maximum ADC values. For example, with ESP32-S3 at 11dB attenuation and val=4095, the
intermediate value val^4 * coeff[4] reached 21,886,129,118,095,003,125, exceeding i64::MAX.

Solution:
Implemented Horner's method for polynomial evaluation:
```err = coeff[0] + val*(coeff[1] + val*(coeff[2] + ...))```

This restructures the calculation to avoid computing large powers of val, keeping all intermediate values within
i64 bounds. The same calculation now peaks at 3,840,004,913,637,219,905 (41.6% of i64::MAX).

Related:
- Closes #3061
- Similar to closed PR #3090

Testing

- Verified mathematically that Horner's method is equivalent to direct evaluation
- Tested all coefficient sets (ESP32-C3/C6/H2/S3, all attenuations) with full 12-bit ADC range (0-4095)
- In my personal ADC project, I've curve-calibrated a B10K pot on an ESP32-S3, getting ~0V-3.16V range with no overflow.

- [ ] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description
This PR uses GHA artifacts to store the API baseline. The workflow would be the following: 
When a PR includes semver breaking changes, we add a label to it (atm its `breaking-changes` but `semver-breaking-changes` or something similar migth be better (?)). This would skip the semver checks, and when the PR is merged it will trigger regenerating the semver baseline and uploading the artifacts to the GHA.

#### Testing
Tested in my fork: 
- Manually trigger the initial semver baseline generation
- Created a PR without the `breaking-change` label, check that the semver checks are executed.
- Add the `breaking-change` label to the PR, verify that the [semver checks are not executed](https://github.com/SergioGasquez/esp-hal/actions/runs/18189910021).
- Verify that merging the PR with the label, triggers the [baseline generation workflow](https://github.com/SergioGasquez/esp-hal/actions/runs/18189932989).

title: wifi_bench: Fix memory layout to fix S2
body: Running the example before this PR just crashes with `unwrap of `Self::try_get()` failed: NoneError`.

title: Change default `wifi_max_burst_size`
body:
The default value of 1 throttles download speed considerably. This makes sense since it limits [TCP window_len](https://github.com/smoltcp-rs/smoltcp/blob/c9a78337bb2da90141ca7bf9f703267fead15b0a/src/iface/packet.rs#L152-L161) in smoltcp. That 2 and 3 have this much impact is surprising to me. In this PR I'm setting the default to 3 which seems to be the sweet spot in the benchmark with my setup.
Details

wifi_bench ---------- wifi_max_burst_size = 1 Testing download... download: 13 kB/s Testing upload... upload: 680 kB/s Testing upload+download... upload+download: 165 kB/s wifi_max_burst_size = 0 Testing download... download: 724 kB/s Testing upload... upload: 737 kB/s Testing upload+download... upload+download: 168 kB/s wifi_max_burst_size = 2 Testing download... download: 559 kB/s Testing upload... upload: 673 kB/s Testing upload+download... upload+download: 161 kB/s wifi_max_burst_size = 10 Testing download... download: 792 kB/s Testing upload... upload: 623 kB/s Testing upload+download... upload+download: 161 kB/s wifi_max_burst_size = 3 Testing download... download: 801 kB/s Testing upload... upload: 695 kB/s Testing upload+download... upload+download: 157 kB/s embassy_wifi_bench ------------------ wifi_max_burst_size = 1 Testing download... connecting to 192.168.0.220:4321... connected, testing... download: 94 kB/s Testing upload... connecting to 192.168.0.220:4322... connected, testing... upload: 693 kB/s Testing upload+download... connecting to 192.168.0.220:4323... connected, testing... upload+download: 121 kB/s wifi_max_burst_size = 0 Testing download... connecting to 192.168.0.220:4321... connected, testing... download: 754 kB/s Testing upload... connecting to 192.168.0.220:4322... connected, testing... upload: 779 kB/s Testing upload+download... connecting to 192.168.0.220:4323... connected, testing... upload+download: 480 kB/s

title: twai: do not abort transmissions on recoverable errors
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [x] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [x] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description

The TWAI driver's interrupt handler currently aborts transmissions if certain (error) interrupts were triggered. This causes the transmission of frames to become unreliable, because the `transmit_async` operation does not return any error codes if a transmission was aborted.

Additionally, the TWAI controller is designed to be a reliable and, with the exception of the bus-off state, normally would simply try to rentransmit a message on its own. Therefore, this commit removes transmission abortion on errors and, instead, only aborts a transmission if the controller changes into the bus-off state.

Fixes #4222

#### Testing

I tested the change using the example provided in #4222 with a setup of three ESP32-C3 (+ CAN-Transceivers) that are connected to each other via a CAN-bus.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description

This adds a way to protect the .trap section (and a good part of rwtext) from overwriting by using watchpoint 1.

It's always enabled but it doesn't set the watchpoint when a debugger is connected.

`skip-changelog` since there are no API changes or options

Additionally, this puts some data which is needs to stay intact for panic  / exception handling above the main stack.

Once we are sure this and the stack-guard monitoring work well we should consider to retire the flip-link functionality

#### Testing
CI / local tests

title: Turn more configs into runtime options
body: cc https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4072

title: Make BLE task priority configurable
body:
cc #4072

I did the bare minimum as I'm not sure which option should be configurable, but hopefully the machinery itself is enough :)

title: RTOS: do not rely on esp-hal's stack guard value config
body: This PR stabilises esp-hal's stack guard offset, and changes esp-rtos to read the stack guard value from memory instead of relying on a foreign (and unstable) constant.

title: Hw-based RTOS stack overflow detection
body:
This PR reuses the results from #4207. Task stacks are now watched by the main task stack watchpoint. The software-based method has been disabled by default.

An unintended, but welcome consequence is that the scheduler is slightly faster without the software-based detection, if there is only a single thread to work with. This slightly improves performance of embassy when esp-radio (and thus, extra threads) is not present.

title: Clean up blocking until deadline
body: Perf-neutral cleanup, just to reduce line count a bit by extracting a common `with_deadline` function.

title: RTOS: Use simpler sync object for executor
body:
This PR improves executor performance (or, well, alleviates some of the regression) by replacing semaphores with flags. Flags are currently internal, they are intended for this purpose only. The perf boost comes from:

- Not having to switch on semaphore type
- Not having a variable maximum value
- There is a constant owner object, not a wait queue - book keeping is simpler this way, but makes the object unfit for general use in its current form.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description

This PR implements the `Into` trait for `PinConfig` so that live matching can be omitted (only once, so it has been moved to another location...?). Another approach was to add a `FrequencyUnset` in `Error`, so there's no need to worry about `unwrap`.

I am a new contributor to this, and I'm glad to improve it! Regarding CHANGELOG, I think it's better to add it after the PR is approved...?

#### Testing

This PR doesn't involve any new functionalities; it's mostly a semantic refactor. I believe the current CI can verify whether changes are accurate.

title: Fix embassy timer queue
body:
Closes #4210

This PR fixes an issue where adding a new embassy task to the timer queue incorrectly overwrote the next wakeup time. This resulted in tasks not getting readied on time. The solution is to correctly track the minimum of the stored wakeup time and the new deadline.

title: Custom idle hooks
body: This PR is intended as an alternative to the old `low-power-wait` configuration - users can register a function that just loops when idle.

title: Monitor the main stack's stack guard
Rename esp-preempt to esp-rtos
body: Closes #4137

title: Print heap stats in QA stress test
body: We have memory leaks in esp-radio. Just so that we don't forget about them, let's print the heap stats in every loop of the QA test.

title: Remove unused re-exports to fix nightly-CI
body: closes https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4198

title: Disable unusable pins for various chips
body: closes https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4187 (see [my comment](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4187#issuecomment-3346346738) there) MISC: I also checked whether the `i2s` HIL test on `esp32` suddenly started working — nope, unfortunately it did not.

title: Prevent double-freeing timers, ensure stack space in debug builds
body: Hopefully fixes #4194

title: only provide __global_pointer$ on riscv
body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [ ] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [ ] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [ ] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [ ] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖
What I just realized is that the symbol is provided unconditionally by https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/pull/4197, while it's really a RISCV-only thing. It probably does no harm on Xtensa, but it might be slightly cleaner if the symbol wasn't defined there?

#### Testing
-

title: xtask: Ignore non-chip features
body:
While our current examples only have chip features, it's quite convenient sometimes to overwrite them with reproducers - but the xtask freaks out if the reproducer has any features other than chip names. This PR relaxes this a bit.

This PR also removes the temporary BTreeSet as we can just iterate over the features directly - a single feature name can't appear twice in Cargo.toml.
